title: GP was disabled due to Draven Glitch
body: To all those shitting themselves, GP wasn't disabled because he died. He was disabled because Allied Dravens could attack his barrels without killing them and refresh his axes.

replies.body: I keep telling people that it was just a joke... and probably covering for a bug.  Riot didn't spend all that time and effort reworking and changing his visuals to delete the guy.  The number of people on this forum who have no idea how to take a joke is too damned high.
Riot should make Spooky Gangplank the only available thing skin for him. Make it happen Rito.

Haha, so Riot disabled GP due to game breaking bugs, then put a cute little message in the disabled window and all these lore hungry fans dove all over it and praised Riot for letting lore drive the game again.

Well played, Riot. Well played.

... you know tahm can literally teamkill, right?

Draven refreshing his axes really doesn't seem like the sort of game-breaking bug they'd disable a champion for.

It especially doesn't seem like the sort of bug that they'd disable a champion for, and then lie about and [claim there was no bug](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/Ey3JIqx8-what-is-the-gangplank-bug?comment=0001) when questioned.

It is pretty game breaking. Gangplank draven botlane, GP puts a barrel behind the minion wave and draven can refresh his axes freely without pushing the wave or putting himself in danger. This also applies effects such as phage and furor, which would make it even more irritating. 

In addition the same Riot poster previously made a comment about no GP nerfs/changes coming in patch 5.15 - implying he is still going to be in the game. The glitch just so happened to coincide with the lore and they are playing it off as a joke, which the large majority of us find hilarious
